intro: Casearia variabilis, commonly known as the variable casearia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Meliaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its small, oval leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically green when mature, containing a single seed. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
